1. Weigh out 30 g of B (Boron); 2. Weigh out 6 g of C (Carbon); 3. Weigh out 20 g of Ca (Calcium); 4. Weigh out 45 g of Ru (Ruthenium); 5. Combine all materials in a clean, dry mixing container.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out 30 g of B (Boron); 2. Weigh out 6 g of C (Carbon); 3. Weigh out 20 g of Ca (Calcium); 4. Weigh out 45 g of Ru (Ruthenium); 5. Combine all materials in a clean, dry mixing container.

steps: 1. Preheat a furnace to 1200 °C; 2. Transfer the mixed powders into a crucible; 3. Heat for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and uniformity.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a furnace to 1200 °C; 2. Transfer the mixed powders into a crucible; 3. Heat for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and uniformity.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool to room temperature naturally (approximately 3-4 hours); 2. Avoid opening the furnace during the cooling process to prevent contamination.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool to room temperature naturally (approximately 3-4 hours); 2. Avoid opening the furnace during the cooling process to prevent contamination.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible; 2. Grind the sample to achieve desired particle size if necessary; 3. Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance durability; 4. Sand the edges to achieve a smooth finish.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible; 2. Grind the sample to achieve desired particle size if necessary; 3. Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance durability; 4. Sand the edges to achieve a smooth finish.
